page.title: 04HISTORY OF EDUCATION
page.content: Originally there were 3 schools in Burscough which had pupils from infants to senior.They were all built in approx. 1850. In 1958 Priory High Secondary School was built to take the senior pupils, from eleven years old, from all the primary schools in Burscough and the surrounding areas (approx. 15 schools). The children passing their eleven-plus scholarship went to Grammar School usually in Ormskirk. In 1978 Priory High became a Comprehensive School taking pupils of all abilities. There is a need for Nursery Education provision in the area. A committee has been formed to promote the scheme. Lordsgate Township Primary School was rebuilt at the end of the 2nd.World War to replace the original building demol- ished to provide an air-field.
